titlestmt.titleproper: American Association for Clinical Chemistry records 1949-1973
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: American Association for Clinical Chemistry records

bioghist.p: Charles Henry Wabnitz (1916-2004) was a biochemist at the Nichols General Veterans Administration Hospital in Louisville, Kentucky, before becoming the Clinical Chemist at the laboratory of the Jewish Hospital in Louisville, where he worked until his retirement. He became a member of the The American Association for Clinical Chemistry (AACC) in 1949, about a year after the association was organized.

scopecontent.p: This small collection consists of Wabnitz's application form and acceptance letter from the AACC, a 1950 AACC member directory, and several pieces of correspondence from the organization to its members.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Chemical Heritage Foundation: American Association for Clinical Chemistry records (97:08;01:07;02:02).
